divs: sighting detailsme and a friend were traveling east by car on 143rd street around 84th ave. when suddenly i saw something move across the night sky. before i could even open my mouth to tell my friend about it he said, "oh my god, did you see that?" it was a very clear night, my car said it was 41 degrees f, and we could even see some stars (very rare for orland park). what we both saw was like a shooting-star but what made it completely different was it's speed and color. it was an aqua-marine\teal color and when it went across the sky it didn't leave a trail, like a shooting star does. it traveled across a huge amount of sky in a pretty straight line in less than a second, but it was bright enough for both of us to see it. after a second it just disapeared in the sky. my first thoughts were extraterrestral because i am unaware of anything man made that can cover such a large amount of sky in a second. i am unhappy that it was such a short experiance because my friend and i might have been the only ones on the road who saw it, although i wasn't looking at the sky and it grabbed my attention easily. if anyone else saw this please let me know.
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Orland Park
There were no other sightings in Orland Park on or around April 14th 2007
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: an object that covered a large area of sky in less than a second
